metadata.name: Linux Base64 Encoded Pipe to Shell
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious process command line that uses base64 encoded input for execution with a shell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('base64 ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| bash ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| sh ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|bash ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|sh '))) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' |sh')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('| sh')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('|bash'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious process command line that uses base64 encoded input for execution with a shell

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities References: https://github.com/arget13/DDexec, https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/barracuda-esg-exploited-globally
